definition: spectator/non-participant
one side/other/different/lateral component of a Chinese character (such as 刂[dao1], 亻[ren2] etc)
surname Guan
to look at/to watch/to observe/to behold/to advise/concept/point of view/outlook
Taoist monastery/palace gate watchtower/platform
observer/spectator
to watch with folded arms (idiom); to look on without lifting a finger
the cool eye of a bystander/a detached point of view
an outsider can see things more clearly or objectively than those involved (idiom)
to watch from the sidelines and do nothing (idiom)
an outsider can see things more clearly or objectively than those involved (idiom)
pinyin: dang1 ju2 zhe3 mi2 , pang2 guan1 zhe3 qing1

sentences.english: He was repaid for his conscientious anxiety in the character of a spectator.
sentences.chinese: 作为一个旁观者，他那从良心出发的焦虑得到了补偿。

sentences.english: There is a looker-on who sits behind my eyes.
sentences.chinese: 有一个旁观者，坐在我的眼睛后面。

sentences.english: A number of Mexican soldiers and by- standers were wounded.
sentences.chinese: 一些墨西哥士兵和旁观者受伤。

sentences.english: Many people only easysted on when the few men robbed a woman.
sentences.chinese: 当那两一自己抢劫一位妇女时，许多人只是旁观。

sentences.english: He allowed no one else to see this process.
sentences.chinese: 他不准任何人旁观这道化妆过程。

sentences.english: We must not stand by when people damage state property.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须与坏人坏事作斗争，不能袖手旁观。

sentences.english: Eventually fall joinville city, the people were massacred in the city, the Ming army on the sidelines is not saved.
sentences.chinese: 最终晋州城陷落，城内百姓惨遭屠杀，明军旁观不救。

sentences.english: Lookers-on all feels to be afraid very much.
sentences.chinese: 旁观者都感到十分害怕。

sentences.english: Never gloat over the ruin of your friend.
sentences.chinese: 不要冷眼旁观看着你的朋友堕落。

sentences.english: The three spectators seemed quite stupefied.
sentences.chinese: 三个旁观者完全惊呆了。

sentences.english: Walking along the clift, those have height phobia please don't do this.
sentences.chinese: 我们走在悬崖旁观看瀑布，惧高者别这样做哦。

sentences.english: Secular ruined, though I will look on coldly.
sentences.chinese: 世俗的荒凉，我却冷眼旁观。

sentences.english: Beauty is in the eyes of the beholders.
Definitely a looker wouldn't you say?
sentences.chinese: 绝对是一个旁观者不会你说什么？

sentences.english: The whole self is the observer and the participator in the roles.
sentences.chinese: 全我是旁观者，也是角色的参与者。

sentences.english: The protesters were throwing bottles at Japanese restaurants, as the police looked on laughing.
sentences.chinese: 抗议者们向日本餐馆扔鞋，警方则袖手旁观看笑话。

definition: the cool eye of a bystander/a detached point of view
observer/spectator
to enjoy watching a bustling scene/to go where the crowds are
cool eye/fig. detached/(treating) with indifference
to keep silent
the person involved/the people holding power
an outsider can see things more clearly or objectively than those involved (idiom)
alongside/nearby
other people/bystanders/onlookers/outsiders
aloof/indifferent/unconcerned
to turn a blind eye to
indifferent/apathetic/cold
to peep at/to spy on/to peek
lit. to take joy in calamity and delight in disaster (idiom); fig. to rejoice in other people's misfortune/Schadenfreude
secret place
cool and collected (idiom); showing no sign of nerves/perfectly composed
